emkornfield opened a new pull request #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763


   Work in progress.
   
   This fixes some error in the C++ build and gets basic code for a python implementation done.
   
   Still needs:
    - unit/integration tests in python
    - Verification that it builds in a wheel.
   


--

emkornfield commented on a change in pull request #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763#discussion_r841092427



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/gcsfs.cc
##########
@@ -536,8 +546,7 @@ class GcsFileSystem::Impl {
                                                            gcs::ReadFromOffset offset) {
     auto stream = client_.ReadObject(path.bucket, path.object, generation, offset);
     ARROW_GCS_RETURN_NOT_OK(stream.status());
-    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, gcs::Generation(),
-                                            offset, client_);
+    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, generation, client_);

Review comment:
       Empirically the underlying tell returns 1000.  I was observing doubling of expected tell value.  The python test that found this wrote N bytes the seemed to N/2 and tried reading.  The reading called the FS tell which returned N




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

URL above to go to the specific comment.

emkornfield commented on a change in pull request #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763#discussion_r841092427



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/gcsfs.cc
##########
@@ -536,8 +546,7 @@ class GcsFileSystem::Impl {
                                                            gcs::ReadFromOffset offset) {
     auto stream = client_.ReadObject(path.bucket, path.object, generation, offset);
     ARROW_GCS_RETURN_NOT_OK(stream.status());
-    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, gcs::Generation(),
-                                            offset, client_);
+    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, generation, client_);

Review comment:
       Empirically the underlying tell returns 1000.  I was observing doubling of expected tell value.  The python test that found this wrote N bytes the seeked to N/2 and tried reading.  The reading called the FS tell which returned N which caused zeo bytes to be read




--

emkornfield commented on a change in pull request #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763#discussion_r841092427



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/gcsfs.cc
##########
@@ -536,8 +546,7 @@ class GcsFileSystem::Impl {
                                                            gcs::ReadFromOffset offset) {
     auto stream = client_.ReadObject(path.bucket, path.object, generation, offset);
     ARROW_GCS_RETURN_NOT_OK(stream.status());
-    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, gcs::Generation(),
-                                            offset, client_);
+    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, generation, client_);

Review comment:
       Empirically the underlying tell returns 1000.  I was observing doubling of expected tell value.  The python test that found this wrote N bytes then seeked to N/2 and tried reading.  The reading called the FS tell which returned N which caused zeo bytes to be read




--

emkornfield commented on a change in pull request #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763#discussion_r841093107



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/gcsfs.cc
##########
@@ -536,8 +546,7 @@ class GcsFileSystem::Impl {
                                                            gcs::ReadFromOffset offset) {
     auto stream = client_.ReadObject(path.bucket, path.object, generation, offset);
     ARROW_GCS_RETURN_NOT_OK(stream.status());
-    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, gcs::Generation(),
-                                            offset, client_);
+    return std::make_shared<GcsInputStream>(std::move(stream), path, generation, client_);

Review comment:
       I looked at the GCS code and it does appear to keep the ReadAt offset to return for tell but I might have missed something




--

emkornfield commented on PR #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763#issuecomment-1099540673

   Ping @pitrou to see if you have time to review.  Also @rok it seems you have been looking at GCS stuff recently.

voutilad commented on PR #12763:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763#issuecomment-1100108681

   FWIW, @emkornfield I had to revert your last commit (608b6ecc7f1841762462f66d06ce880fd9bb02a2) in order to get tests to work. It seems if the testbench suite doesn't properly initialize, the GcsFileSystem tests hang until the ctest timeout. (This is using `archery docker build ubuntu-cpp`.)

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

comments.body: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11569 adds the dependency for the wheels, so enabling the {{ARROW_GCS}} flag in {{ci/scripts/python_wheel_*_build.sh}} along with a {{PYARROW_GCS}} flag should handle the wheel packaging aspects.
[~emkornfield] Are you making progress on this?
Yes, spending some time on it today and hopefully have a PR up this week.  I might need some help with python packaging.
